title: James Moorhouse (politician)
text:
Cecil James Olaf Moorhouse (1 January 1924 – 6 January 2014) was a British politician and former <a href="Member%20of%20the%20European%20Parliament">Member of the European Parliament</a>.
He was educated at <a href="St%20Paul%27s%20School%20%28London%29">St Paul's School</a>, London, <a href="King%27s%20College%20London">King's College London</a> (BSc Eng, 1945) and <a href="Imperial%20College%20London">Imperial College London</a> where here took a diploma in advanced aeronautics. He served as <a href="Conservative%20Party%20%28UK%29">Conservative</a> <a href="Member%20of%20the%20European%20Parliament">MEP</a> for <a href="London%20South%20%28European%20Parliament%20constituency%29">London South</a> from 1979 to 1984, and as <a href="Conservative%20Party%20%28UK%29">Conservative</a> <a href="Member%20of%20the%20European%20Parliament">MEP</a> for <a href="London%20South%20and%20Surrey%20East%20%28European%20Parliament%20constituency%29">London South and Surrey East</a> from 1984 until October 1998 when he "defected to the <a href="Liberal%20Democrats%20%28UK%29">Liberal Democrats</a> after disagreeing with <a href="William%20Hague">Mr Hague's</a> policy on the <a href="euro">euro</a>." He remained in the <a href="European%20Parliament">European Parliament</a> as <a href="Liberal%20Democrats%20%28UK%29">Liberal Democrat</a> <a href="Member%20of%20the%20European%20Parliament">MEP</a> for <a href="London%20South%20and%20Surrey%20East%20%28European%20Parliament%20constituency%29">London South and Surrey East</a> until 1999.
